channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: OVO: Open-Vocabulary Occupancy
item.description: Semantic occupancy prediction aims to infer dense geometry and semantics of surroundings for an autonomous agent to operate safely in the 3D environment.

item.title: VanillaKD: Revisit the Power of Vanilla Knowledge Distillation from Small Scale to Large Scale
item.description: The tremendous success of large models trained on extensive datasets demonstrates that scale is a key ingredient in achieving superior results.

item.title: Text-to-Motion Retrieval: Towards Joint Understanding of Human Motion Data and Natural Language
item.description: Due to recent advances in pose-estimation methods, human motion can be extracted from a common video in the form of 3D skeleton sequences.

item.title: Unifying gradient regularization for Heterogeneous Graph Neural Networks
item.description: Grug provides a unified framework integrating graph topology and node features, based on which we conduct a detailed theoretical analysis of their effectiveness.

item.title: MTCue: Learning Zero-Shot Control of Extra-Textual Attributes by Leveraging Unstructured Context in Neural Machine Translation
item.description: This work introduces MTCue, a novel neural machine translation (NMT) framework that interprets all context (including discrete variables) as text.

item.title: UFO: Unified Fact Obtaining for Commonsense Question Answering
item.description: UFO turns LLMs into knowledge sources and produces relevant facts (knowledge statements) for the given question.

item.title: Enhancing Grammatical Error Correction Systems with Explanations
item.description: Grammatical error correction systems improve written communication by detecting and correcting language mistakes.

item.title: Detecting Adversarial Data by Probing Multiple Perturbations Using Expected Perturbation Score
item.description: Last, we propose an EPS-based adversarial detection (EPS-AD) method, in which we develop EPS-based maximum mean discrepancy (MMD) as a metric to measure the discrepancy between the test sample and natural samples.

item.title: Scaling Data-Constrained Language Models
item.description: We find that with constrained data for a fixed compute budget, training with up to 4 epochs of repeated data yields negligible changes to loss compared to having unique data.

item.title: Learn to Not Link: Exploring NIL Prediction in Entity Linking
item.description: We conduct a series of experiments with the widely used bi-encoder and cross-encoder entity linking models, results show that both types of NIL mentions in training data have a significant influence on the accuracy of NIL prediction.

item.title: Fascinating Supervisory Signals and Where to Find Them: Deep Anomaly Detection with Scale Learning
item.description: Due to the unsupervised nature of anomaly detection, the key to fueling deep models is finding supervisory signals.

item.title: Combinatorial Bandits for Maximum Value Reward Function under Max Value-Index Feedback
item.description: We propose an algorithm and provide a regret bound for problem instances with stochastic arm outcomes according to arbitrary distributions with finite supports.

item.title: Diversity-Aware Coherence Loss for Improving Neural Topic Models
item.description: The standard approach for neural topic modeling uses a variational autoencoder (VAE) framework that jointly minimizes the KL divergence between the estimated posterior and prior, in addition to the reconstruction loss.

item.title: Sharpness-Aware Minimization Revisited: Weighted Sharpness as a Regularization Term
item.description: Deep Neural Networks (DNNs) generalization is known to be closely related to the flatness of minima, leading to the development of Sharpness-Aware Minimization (SAM) for seeking flatter minima and better generalization.

item.title: Detecting Dataset Drift and Non-IID Sampling via k-Nearest Neighbors
item.description: We present a straightforward statistical test to detect certain violations of the assumption that the data are Independent and Identically Distributed (IID).

item.title: A Survey on Asking Clarification Questions Datasets in Conversational Systems
item.description: The ability to understand a user's underlying needs is critical for conversational systems, especially with limited input from users in a conversation.

item.title: UniTRec: A Unified Text-to-Text Transformer and Joint Contrastive Learning Framework for Text-based Recommendation
item.description: Moreover, conditioned on user history encoded by Transformer encoders, our framework leverages Transformer decoders to estimate the language perplexity of candidate text items, which can serve as a straightforward yet significant contrastive signal for user-item text matching.

item.title: UpMax: User partitioning for MaxSAT
item.description: It has been shown that Maximum Satisfiability (MaxSAT) problem instances can be effectively solved by partitioning the set of soft clauses into several disjoint sets.

item.title: Diversify Your Vision Datasets with Automatic Diffusion-Based Augmentation
item.description: We introduce ALIA (Automated Language-guided Image Augmentation), a method which utilizes large vision and language models to automatically generate natural language descriptions of a dataset's domains and augment the training data via language-guided image editing.

item.title: C-MCTS: Safe Planning with Monte Carlo Tree Search
item.description: We propose Constrained MCTS (C-MCTS), an algorithm that estimates cost using a safety critic.

item.title: Referred by Multi-Modality: A Unified Temporal Transformer for Video Object Segmentation
item.description: In this paper, we propose MUTR, a Multi-modal Unified Temporal transformer for Referring video object segmentation.

item.title: LFTK: Handcrafted Features in Computational Linguistics
item.description: We open-source our system for public access to a rich set of pre-implemented handcrafted features.

item.title: Feature Collapse
item.description: We formalize and study a phenomenon called feature collapse that makes precise the intuitive idea that entities playing a similar role in a learning task receive similar representations.

item.title: Revisiting non-English Text Simplification: A Unified Multilingual Benchmark
item.description: However, less work has been done on multilingual text simplification due to the lack of a diverse evaluation benchmark that covers complex-simple sentence pairs in many languages.

item.title: Exploiting Noise as a Resource for Computation and Learning in Spiking Neural Networks
item.description: Our approach shows how noise may act as a resource for computation and learning and theoretically provides a framework for general SNNs.

item.title: TLNets: Transformation Learning Networks for long-range time-series prediction
item.description: Note that the FT and SVD blocks are capable of learning global information, while the Conv blocks focus on learning local information.

item.title: MPE4G: Multimodal Pretrained Encoder for Co-Speech Gesture Generation
item.description: Through the series of experiments and human evaluation, the proposed method renders realistic co-speech gestures not only when all input modalities are given but also when the input modalities are missing or noisy.

item.title: Knowledge Diffusion for Distillation
item.description: To address this, we propose to denoise student features using a diffusion model trained by teacher features.

item.title: CSS: A Large-scale Cross-schema Chinese Text-to-SQL Medical Dataset
item.description: Furthermore, we present CSS, a large-scale CrosS-Schema Chinese text-to-SQL dataset, to carry on corresponding studies.

item.title: Bhasha-Abhijnaanam: Native-script and romanized Language Identification for 22 Indic languages
item.description: We create publicly available language identification (LID) datasets and models in all 22 Indian languages listed in the Indian constitution in both native-script and romanized text.

item.title: NaSGEC: a Multi-Domain Chinese Grammatical Error Correction Dataset from Native Speaker Texts
item.description: We introduce NaSGEC, a new dataset to facilitate research on Chinese grammatical error correction (CGEC) for native speaker texts from multiple domains.

item.title: The Benefits of Being Distributional: Small-Loss Bounds for Reinforcement Learning
item.description: While distributional reinforcement learning (RL) has demonstrated empirical success, the question of when and why it is beneficial has remained unanswered.

item.title: NexToU: Efficient Topology-Aware U-Net for Medical Image Segmentation
item.description: Motivated by the successful breakthroughs of graph neural networks (GNN) in capturing topological properties and non-Euclidean relationships across various fields, we propose NexToU, a novel hybrid architecture for medical image segmentation.

item.title: ProlificDreamer: High-Fidelity and Diverse Text-to-3D Generation with Variational Score Distillation
item.description: In this work, we propose to model the 3D parameter as a random variable instead of a constant as in SDS and present variational score distillation (VSD), a principled particle-based variational framework to explain and address the aforementioned issues in text-to-3D generation.

item.title: Securing Deep Generative Models with Universal Adversarial Signature
item.description: Prior research attempted to mitigate these threats by detecting generated images, but the varying traces left by different generative models make it challenging to create a universal detector capable of generalizing to new, unseen generative models.

item.title: Trans-Dimensional Generative Modeling via Jump Diffusion Models
item.description: We propose a new class of generative models that naturally handle data of varying dimensionality by jointly modeling the state and dimension of each datapoint.

item.title: Unifying GANs and Score-Based Diffusion as Generative Particle Models
item.description: In this paper, we challenge this interpretation and propose a novel framework that unifies particle and adversarial generative models by framing generator training as a generalization of particle models.

item.title: Camera-Incremental Object Re-Identification with Identity Knowledge Evolution
item.description: In this paper, we propose a novel Identity Knowledge Evolution (IKE) framework for CIOR, consisting of the Identity Knowledge Association (IKA), Identity Knowledge Distillation (IKD), and Identity Knowledge Update (IKU).

item.title: MixFormerV2: Efficient Fully Transformer Tracking
item.description: Our key design is to introduce four special prediction tokens and concatenate them with the tokens from target template and search areas.

item.title: Uni-ControlNet: All-in-One Control to Text-to-Image Diffusion Models
item.description: Text-to-Image diffusion models have made tremendous progress over the past two years, enabling the generation of highly realistic images based on open-domain text descriptions.

item.title: Beyond Reward: Offline Preference-guided Policy Optimization
item.description: Instead, the agent is provided with pre-existing offline trajectories and human preferences between pairs of trajectories to extract the dynamics and task information, respectively.

item.title: Non-adversarial training of Neural SDEs with signature kernel scores
item.description: Neural SDEs are continuous-time generative models for sequential data.

item.title: Learning Directed Graphical Models with Optimal Transport
item.description: Estimating the parameters of a probabilistic directed graphical model from incomplete data remains a long-standing challenge.

item.title: A Guide Through the Zoo of Biased SGD
item.description: Although SGD with unbiased gradient estimators has been studied extensively over at least half a century, SGD variants relying on biased estimators are rare.

item.title: MEMEX: Detecting Explanatory Evidence for Memes via Knowledge-Enriched Contextualization
item.description: In this work, we propose a novel task, MEMEX - given a meme and a related document, the aim is to mine the context that succinctly explains the background of the meme.

item.title: Learning Occupancy for Monocular 3D Object Detection
item.description: Monocular 3D detection is a challenging task due to the lack of accurate 3D information.

item.title: Multilingual Text-to-Speech Synthesis for Turkic Languages Using Transliteration
item.description: This work aims to build a multilingual text-to-speech (TTS) synthesis system for ten lower-resourced Turkic languages: Azerbaijani, Bashkir, Kazakh, Kyrgyz, Sakha, Tatar, Turkish, Turkmen, Uyghur, and Uzbek.

item.title: Revisiting Non-Autoregressive Translation at Scale
item.description: In real-world systems, scaling has been critical for improving the translation quality in autoregressive translation (AT), which however has not been well studied for non-autoregressive translation (NAT).

item.title: Anomaly Detection with Conditioned Denoising Diffusion Models
item.description: We propose a novel denoising process for image reconstruction conditioned on a target image.

item.title: Market Making with Deep Reinforcement Learning from Limit Order Books
item.description: This paper proposes a RL agent for market making with LOB data.
